problem_text:
Let F be the nonabelian free group on two generators x, y. For a, b ∈ C, |a| = |b| = 1, let ϑa,b be the automorphism of CF defined by ϑa,b(x) = ax, ϑa,b(y) = by. Given 0 ̸= α ∈ CF, can we always find a, b ∈ C \ {1} with |a| = |b| = 1 such that αCF ∩ ϑa,b(α)CF ̸= 0?
P. A. Linnell
answer: No, not always (A. V. Tushev, Ukrain. Mat. J., 47, no. 4 (1995), 571–572).
